MSqb2 0.2.1

Impute Missing Values in Data

impute_missing_values.Rd

This function imputes missing values in a data set using various imputation methods. It supports a range of imputation techniques including K-nearest neighbors (KNN), maximum likelihood estimation (MLE), quantile regression imputation for left-censored data (QRILC), and hybrid methods combining different strategies for missing at random (MAR) and missing not at random (MNAR) data.

Usage

impute_missing_values(
  dat,
  val = "Abundance",
  col.p = "Filename",
  row.p = "Feature",
  na.imputation.method = "v2-mnar",
  hybrid.mar = "KNN",
  hybrid.mnar = "QRILC",
  n_knn = 15,
  tune.sigma = 0.5,
  q = 0.01,
  ...
)

Arguments

dat

A data.table containing the data to be imputed. The table should include columns corresponding to features, samples, and values to be imputed.

val

A character string specifying the column name that contains the values to be imputed. Default is "Abundance".

col.p

A character string specifying the column name(s) that either contains unique sample names (e.g., "Filename"), or a combination of which can be used to uniqule address each sample (e.g., c("Pool", "Channel") for MS method TMT). Default is "Filename".

row.p

A character string specifying the column name that contains the feature identifiers. Default is "Feature".

na.imputation.method

A character string specifying the method to use for imputation. Options include:

  • "V2": method v2 of the msImpute package

  • "V2-MNAR": method v2-mnar of the msImpute method specifically for MNAR data.

  • "QRILC": Quantile Regression Imputation of Left-Censored data.

  • "KNN": K-nearest neighbors.

  • "MLE": Maximum Likelihood Estimation.

  • "MINPROB": Impute using the minimal probability.

  • "MINDET": Impute using the minimal detection limit.

  • "ZERO": Impute with zeros.

  • "HYBRID": Hybrid method combining MAR and MNAR strategies.

Default is "v2-mnar".

hybrid.mar

A character string specifying the method to use for MAR imputation when using the hybrid approach. Default is "KNN".

hybrid.mnar

A character string specifying the method to use for MNAR imputation when using the hybrid approach. Default is "QRILC".

n_knn

An integer specifying the number of nearest neighbors to use for KNN imputation. Default is 15.

tune.sigma

A numeric value specifying the tuning parameter for the sigma in QRILC and MinProb methods. Default is 0.5.

q

A numeric value specifying the quantile for MinDet and MinProb methods. Default is 0.01.

...

Additional arguments passed to the imputation functions.

Value

A data.table containing the original data with missing values imputed.

Details

The impute_missing_values function offers several methods for imputing missing data, depending on the nature of the missingness and the experimental design. For in-depth details please refere to vignette of the packages msImpute and imputeLCMD.

  • "v2": This method, provided by the msImpute package, is designed for missing at random (MAR) data. It is particularly suitable for DIA experiments where missing values are assumed to be random.

  • "v2-mnar": This method extends "v2" to handle missing not at random (MNAR) data, making it suitable for cases where missing values are more likely for low-abundance features. This is often the case in DDA (like TMT) experiments, where the absence of data might be systematically related to the intensity of the signal.
